Detailed Description

File filter filtering files by a name pattern

Class NamePatternFileFilter is a predefined file filter functor which filters files by comparing the filename to a name pattern which is allowed to contain the asterisk * and/or question mark ? wildcards. Optionally directories get filtered, too.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

NamePatternFileFilter::NamePatternFileFilter (  const WString &  name_pattern,
BOOLEAN  case_sensitive = TRUE,
BOOLEAN  filter_dirs = FALSE
) 
 

Constructs a name pattern file filter. The name_pattern is allowed to contain the wildcards * and/or ?. Argument case_sensitive specifies whether the name pattern is treated case sensitive or not. If filter_dirs is TRUE then all directories get filtered, too.

Parameters:
name_pattern A name pattern optionally using wildcards * and/or ?.
case_sensitive Case sensitivity of name pattern.
filter_dirs Tells if directories shall be filtered.

NamePatternFileFilter::~NamePatternFileFilter (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Destroys a name pattern file filter.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN NamePatternFileFilter::Complies (  const Path &  path  )  [virtual]
 

Tells if the file with path complies with the name pattern specified on construction or is a directory in case it shall filter directories, too.

Parameters:
path The path of the file to filter.
Returns:
Tells if the file with path complies with the filter.

Implements FileFilter.

Returns the name pattern.
